title: Frank Kendall III
added: On April 27, 2021, President [[Joe Biden]] announced Kendall as his nominee to be the 26th secretary of the Air Force.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.whitehouse.gov/briefing-room/statements-releases/2021/04/27/president-biden-announces-key-administration-nominations-in-national-security-2/|title=President Biden Announces Key Administration Nominations in National Security|date=2021-04-26|website=whitehouse.gov}}</ref> His Senate confirmation occurred after almost three months of deliberation, due to holds by senators [[Mike Lee (American politician)|Mike Lee]],<ref>{{cite web|url=https://defensecommunities.org/2021/06/senators-slow-down-kendall-confirmation/|title=Senators Slow Down Kendall Confirmation|date=2021-06-28|website=Association of Defense Communities}}</ref> [[Gary Peters]],<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.detroitnews.com/story/news/politics/2021/07/26/peters-ends-hold-biden-nominee-after-air-force-commits-selfridge/8090821002/|title=Peters ends hold on Biden nominee after Air Force commits to Selfridge mission|last=Burke|first=Melissa Nann|date=2021-07-26|website=Detroit News}}</ref> and [[Elizabeth Warren]],<ref name="Warren">{{cite web|url=https://www.airforcemag.com/warren-lifts-hold-on-kendall-nomination-after-ethics-agreement-extension/|title=Warren Lifts Hold on Kendall Nomination After Ethics Agreement Extension|first=Abraham|last=Mahshie|date=2021-07-13|website=Air Force Magazine}}</ref> the latter of whom released her hold after Kendall agreed to extend his post-governmental recusal agreements from two to four years.<ref name="Warren"/> Kendall was eventually confirmed by voice vote on June 26, 2021,<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.congress.gov/nomination/117th-congress/484|title=PN484 — Frank Kendall III — Department of Defense, 117th Congress (2021-2022)|access-date=2021-09-05|website=U.S. Congress}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.af.mil/News/Article-Display/Article/2708030/senate-confirms-kendall-to-be-air-force-secretary/|title=Senate confirms Kendall to be Air Force Secretary|last=Pope|first=Charles|publisher=Secretary of the Air Force Public Affairs|date=2021-07-26|website=U.S. Air Force}}</ref> administratively sworn in on July 28, 2021,<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.spaceforce.mil/News/Article/2711279/kendall-sworn-in-as-26th-secretary-of-the-air-force|title=Kendall sworn in as 26th Secretary of the Air Force|author=Staff Sgt. Nicolas Z. Erwin|publisher=Secretary of the Air Force Public Affairs|date=2021-07-28|website=U.S. Space Force}}</ref> and ceremonially sworn in by secretary of defense [[Lloyd Austin]] on August 4, 2021.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.dvidshub.net/image/6766106/sd-swears-secaf-kendall|title=SD swears in SECAF Kendall [Image 9 of 24]|date=2021-08-04|website=DVIDS}}</ref>
